You killed runekeepers in an attempt to decipher what the demons are up to in the Tainted Gorge, but to no avail.

Sersine, however, ordered you to kill the demonic enforcer, Kugai. You recovered a codex from his corpse, which may reveal more about the dark forces on the Island of Dawn.

Demons are involved? You're kidding. Took Leander actual research to say that?

At any rate, got a mission for you. {@LinkCreature:13#8#Runekeepers} are chiseling runes out of any flat surface they can find. Beat down the demons and bring me the runes.

Perhaps we'll discover just what they're after.

Bleh. These runes mean nothing to me. This green one looks like something with tentacles on its face.

Oh, well. Runekeepers are demons. They're still worth killing.

Sersine's agitated about somethingâ€”or as agitated as a high elf gets. Report to her and do what you can. And you might as well bring the runes along.
As my amani friends say, they're not gonna stab themselves! Get back out there and kill some runekeepers. I want to see what they're scribing!

While the runes led nowhere, this next task might.

{@LinkCreature:13#1004#Kugai} wanders along the road, enforcing the peace amongst the demons, and barking out orders.

He must be slain. If nothing else, the death of the most powerful enforcer might start the demons fighting amongst themselves.

Kugai was carrying this? I wonder why. Unfortunately, demons just aren't my area of expertise.

It's certainly difficult to read; perhaps Leander or Adria could better translate it.

But, wait...here's something I recognize, at least!

According to this codex, Kugai was sent to patrol the roads by a demon named Karascha. I remember him! He commanded the demonic forces that defeated the first expedition.

It sounds like he was injured in the fighting, though, and is hiding out not far from here while he recovers. That would explain why there are so many demons in this area!

If Karascha is eliminated, it should break their morale, and maybe we could finally finish the mission we came here to do!
